title: Test miden-cli account creation on testnet
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Install miden-cli via cargo and test account creation on testnet.

1. Install: cargo install miden-cli (or similar)
2. Create an account on testnet
3. Document the script/commands used
4. Document the results

Use cargo version - no need to build from source.

```
echo "  Proxy:       http://localhost:8546"
```

title: Android: Wire file picker to load database
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

CRITICAL: FilePickerScreen saves URI but doesn't load database.

The app shows sample data instead of real OmniFocus data.

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Create DatabaseLoader.kt in data/ package:
   - Function to read .ofocus bundle from SAF URI
   - Parse ZIP files in the bundle
   - Extract and parse XML content using OFParser
   - Return OFDatabase object

2. Wire FilePickerScreen:
   - After URI selected, trigger database loading
   - Show loading indicator while parsing

3. Wire MainScreen/App startup:
   - On app start, check AppPreferences for saved URI
   - If exists, load database automatically
   - Call ViewModel.setDatabase() with loaded data

4. Remove sample data fallback:
   - TaskViewModel should NOT call loadSampleData() in init
   - Show empty state until database is loaded

5. Error handling:
   - Handle parsing errors gracefully
   - Show error message if database cannot be read
close_reason: Created DatabaseLoader for SAF URI reading, wired FilePickerScreen and app startup to load database, removed sample data fallback

title: Final: MidenClient P2ID note submission to network
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Final integration piece for eth_sendRawTransaction:

Already integrated (from hq-dkgx + hq-dhls):
✓ decode_transaction() for raw tx parsing
✓ is_claim_asset() + parse_claim_asset() 
✓ ClaimTracker replay prevention
✓ AddressMapper Eth→Miden address mapping
✓ tx hash generation + pending status tracking

Still TODO:
- Initialize MidenClient with config (init_client)
- Create P2ID note (create_bridge_claim_note)
- Build transaction request (build_claim_transaction_request)
- Submit to Miden network (submit_transaction)
- Update receipt status from pending to confirmed

Use functions from src/client.rs
close_reason: Integrated claim processing into eth_sendRawTransaction - full pipeline except network submission

description:
dispatched_by: mayor

When proxy receives a claimAsset transaction, log:
- Transaction hash
- Parsed amount (in human readable format, e.g. '2.31 LUMIA')
- Destination address
- Origin token

This helps debug issues like the amount overflow by showing what values are being parsed.

Add info! logs in the claim processing path with these details.

title: Fix keystore directory error: Not a directory
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Error during Miden submission:
```
failed to initialize miden client: client initialization error: storage error: error creating keys directory: Os { code: 20, kind: NotADirectory, message: "Not a directory" }
```

The keystore path logic is creating a file where a directory should be, or there's a path conflict. Check src/main.rs around line 766 and the client initialization. The keystore_path is likely pointing to a file instead of a directory.

After fix: test full flow with start-all.sh --clean && test-lumia-claims.sh 1, check proxy logs for errors or success.

title: Tasks shown as projects, folder clicks not working
description:
User reports three issues after database loads:
1. Tasks are being treated/displayed as projects
2. Clicking on folders does nothing (no navigation)
3. Archived/completed tasks showing as available (filter not working)

Look at:
- How isProject is determined in OFTask (project != null)
- ProjectsScreen folder/project click handlers
- Navigation routes for folder vs project detail
- TaskFilter logic - completed tasks should be filtered out in AVAILABLE view

Compare with Go implementation in go/pkg/ofocus/ for correct logic.

title: Add screenshot button that captures map to clipboard
Implement eth_call bridge state queries
description:
Current eth_call is a stub returning '0x'.

Spec says: 'Simulate bridge state queries'

Should decode calldata and return appropriate bridge contract state (e.g., deposit status, claim status).

title: Document manual testing setup for miden proxy
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create docs/TESTING.md documenting:

## Prerequisites
- Docker and docker-compose

## Quick Start
```
./scripts/start-all.sh --clean   # Start all services
./scripts/test-lumia-claims.sh   # Run test transactions
```

## Scripts

### scripts/start-all.sh
- Starts miden-node in background
- Waits for health checks
- --clean flag removes volumes for fresh start

### scripts/start-miden-node.sh
- Starts only miden-node (foreground)
- --clean flag available

### scripts/start-proxy.sh
- Builds and runs the proxy locally
- Connects to miden-node

### scripts/test-lumia-claims.sh
- Sends 10 real Lumia claimAsset transactions
- Usage: ./test-lumia-claims.sh [1] [2] [3]  # specific vectors
- Shows transaction results and logs

## Docker Setup
- Dockerfile.miden-node: Builds miden-node from source (agglayer-v0.1)
- config/genesis.toml: Genesis config with MIDEN faucet

## Ports
- 57291: miden-node gRPC
- 8546: proxy RPC endpoint

title: Fix miden-node Dockerfile to use proper setup from docs
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Use the official setup guide: https://docs.miden.xyz/miden-tutorials/miden_node_setup/

The Dockerfile must:
1. Build from source (cargo build --release) at tag agglayer-v0.1 from https://github.com/0xMiden/miden-node
2. Create data/ and accounts/ directories
3. On container start: run bootstrap then start

Proper startup sequence:
```
# Bootstrap (generates genesis)
miden-node bundled bootstrap --data-directory /data --accounts-directory /accounts

# Start node
miden-node bundled start --data-directory /data --rpc.url http://0.0.0.0:57291
```

Create an entrypoint script that:
1. Checks if /data is empty, if so runs bootstrap
2. Starts the node with bundled start

The node listens on port 57291.

title: Calendar-based invoice generation with bank holiday awareness
description:
Add invoice generation scheduling that calculates when to generate an invoice based on:

1. Invoice due date
2. Minus 'days to pay' (payment terms)
3. Adjusted for bank holidays of BOTH sender and recipient countries

Components needed:
- Bank holiday calendar data structure (support multiple countries)
- Working day calculator service (skip weekends + holidays)
- Invoice generation scheduler model
- Configuration for company payment terms and country associations
- Suggest automatic generation based on calculated dates

This is a proactive generation system (calendar → generate) separate from the existing reactive filing system (file arrives → organize).

title: Create docker-compose.local.yml for minimal testing setup
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The full docker-compose.yml has dependencies on bridge-service and l1-anvil which require ghcr.io auth.

For decode testing, create docker-compose.local.yml with ONLY:
1. miden-node (build from Dockerfile.miden-node)
2. proxy (build from Dockerfile, but without bridge-service dependency)

The proxy should:
- Connect to miden-node
- NOT require postgres, bridge-service, or l1-anvil
- Use mock/dummy values for BRIDGE_SERVICE_URL and L1_RPC_URL

Update start-all.sh to use docker-compose.local.yml:
```
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d miden-node
docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d proxy
```

This allows decode testing without external dependencies.

title: Implement P2ID note creation following miden-base bridge_in.rs pattern
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Follow these references to properly create P2ID notes for bridge claims:

1. miden-base test: https://github.com/0xMiden/miden-base/blob/agglayer-v0.1/crates/miden-testing/tests/agglayer/bridge_in.rs#L34
2. Tutorial: http://docs.miden.xyz/miden-tutorials/rust-client/mint_consume_create_tutorial#step-4-sending-tokens-to-other-accounts

Key points:
- Use the right network configuration
- Use correct account setup
- Create P2ID notes properly with create_p2id_note()
- Match the pattern from bridge_in.rs test

This should complete the Miden submission flow.
close_reason: CLAIM note flow implemented with create_bridge_claim_note(). Ephemeral account sync added. Port args and full commit hash also fixed. End-to-end requires agglayer faucet with L1 deposits.

title: Fix GIT_COMMIT injection in Docker builds
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Proxy shows 'Version: unknown' in Docker builds. The GIT_COMMIT build arg isn't being passed correctly.

Check:
1. docker-compose.local.yml - GIT_COMMIT arg should be set
2. start-all.sh - should export GIT_COMMIT=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) before docker compose build
3. Dockerfile - should have ARG GIT_COMMIT and ENV GIT_COMMIT=$GIT_COMMIT

Make sure the commit SHA flows through: script → docker-compose → Dockerfile → runtime env
close_reason: Merged to main - GIT_COMMIT injection with GitHub link

title: Version still shows unknown - GIT_COMMIT not passed to Docker
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Despite previous fix, proxy still shows 'Version: unknown' in logs.

The GIT_COMMIT env var is not reaching the runtime. Debug:
1. Check if start-all.sh exports GIT_COMMIT before docker compose build
2. Check if docker-compose.local.yml passes GIT_COMMIT as build arg
3. Check if Dockerfile ARG/ENV is correct
4. May need to pass as runtime env var instead of build arg

Test: docker inspect proxy container to see if GIT_COMMIT env is set
close_reason: Merged - GIT_COMMIT passed as runtime env var

title: AggLayer-Miden Proxy Cleanup Epic
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Cleanup tasks identified from spec audit.

## Spec Gaps
- Miden client submission not wired up (core gap)
- eth_blockNumber returns 0 (needs Miden sync)
- eth_call is a stub (needs bridge state queries)
- Rate limiting not implemented
- IP allowlist not implemented

## TODOs in Code
- address_mapper.rs:189 - Set proper AccountId type bits
- main.rs:423 - Submit to Miden network

## Audit Summary
8/8 JSON-RPC methods defined, but 3 have partial implementations.

title: Complete integration: AddressMapper + MidenClient submission
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Follow-up from hq-dkgx partial completion:

Toast integrated:
✓ Hex decode → RLP decode
✓ is_claim_asset() validation  
✓ parse_claim_asset() parsing
✓ ClaimTracker deduplication
✓ tx hash generation

Still TODO:
- AddressMapper integration (map destination_address to Miden AccountId)
- MidenClient integration (create P2ID note, submit transaction)
- Receipt tracking with actual Miden transaction status
- eth_blockNumber should query actual Miden block height

title: CRITICAL: Integrate claim processing into eth_sendRawTransaction
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Spec Audit Finding: eth_sendRawTransaction is NOT implemented!

Current state: Generates placeholder hash, logs warning, returns immediately.

Required implementation:
1. Decode raw tx using decode::decode_transaction()
2. Parse claimAsset calldata using decode::parse_claim_asset()
3. Check deduplication via ClaimTracker::try_claim()
4. Map Eth address to Miden using AddressMapper
5. Create P2ID note using client::create_bridge_claim_note()
6. Build tx request using client::build_claim_transaction_request()
7. Submit to Miden using client::submit_transaction()
8. Store tx hash mapping in ReceiptStore

Files to modify:
- src/main.rs - Wire up the modules

Files that are DONE but need integration:
- src/decode.rs
- src/claim_tracker.rs
- src/address_mapper.rs
- src/client.rs
- src/receipt.rs

title: Fix miden-node healthcheck - use curl or nc instead of grpc_health_probe
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The grpc_health_probe fails because miden-node doesn't implement gRPC Health service.

Change miden-node healthcheck in docker-compose.yml from:
```
test: ["CMD", "grpc_health_probe", "-addr=:57291"]
```

To use netcat to check if port is listening:
```
test: ["CMD-SHELL", "nc -z localhost 57291 || exit 1"]
```

Or use curl to check if something responds (may need to install nc in Dockerfile.miden-node if not present).

Also update docker-compose.test.yml if it has the same issue.

title: Add extensive console logging to proxy
description:
User request: Add extensive logging for all proxy operations.

Required logging:

- Transaction decoding steps (raw → decoded tx → claimAsset params)
- Claim tracking decisions (new vs duplicate)
- Address mapping (lookup hits/misses, new mappings created)
- Miden client operations (init, note creation, tx submission)
- Receipt status updates

Use tracing macros: info!, debug!, warn!, error!
Ensure env_filter allows configurable log levels.

title: Add genesis config file to miden-node Dockerfile
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The bootstrap command needs --genesis-config-file.

Add this genesis.toml to the Docker image:
```toml
timestamp = 1717344256
version   = 1

[native_faucet]
decimals   = 3
max_supply = 100_000_000
symbol     = "MIDEN"

[fee_parameters]
verification_base_fee = 0

[[fungible_faucet]]
decimals     = 3
max_supply   = 100_000_000
storage_mode = "public"
symbol       = "WHAT"

[[wallet]]
assets       = [{ amount = 999_000, symbol = "MIDEN" }]
storage_mode = "private"

[[wallet]]
assets       = [{ amount = 777, symbol = "MIDEN" }]
storage_mode = "private"

[[wallet]]
assets       = [{ amount = 1, symbol = "WHAT" }]
storage_mode = "private"
```

1. Create config/genesis.toml with above content
2. COPY it into the Docker image at /app/genesis.toml
3. Update entrypoint to add: --genesis-config-file /app/genesis.toml

title: Dropped projects and their tasks should be hidden
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

User reports: Projects marked as 'dropped' (and tasks inside them marked 'dropped with container') still show up in the UI. They should be hidden by default.

EXAMPLE: 'MWTT' project in ~/Desktop/OmniFocus.ofocus is dropped but still shows in Android app.

In OmniFocus:
- Projects have a status field in <project><status>dropped</status></project>
- When a project is dropped, its child tasks inherit 'dropped with container' status
- Dropped items should NOT appear in Inbox, Projects, or other views

Fix locations:
1. Check OFProjectInfo.status field - 'dropped' status means hidden
2. In TaskViewModel filters, exclude:
   - Tasks whose project.status == 'dropped'
   - Tasks that are children of dropped projects
3. ProjectsScreen should filter out dropped projects

Compare with Go implementation for status handling.
close_reason: Added isDropped filter, hiding dropped projects and their tasks from all views

title: Pass keystore to init_client for keypair management
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The keystore should be passed to init_client so the same instance can be used to add keypairs (not create another instance).

This allows:
- init_client receives keystore as parameter
- Same keystore object used for client init AND keypair additions
- No duplicate keystore instances

title: Tasks shown as projects + stale data not cleaned up
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

User reports:
1. Some tasks still incorrectly shown as projects
2. Tasks shown are stale/old versions - database not cleaning up properly

Root causes to investigate:
1. isProject logic: In OFTask, isProject = (project != null). But in OmniFocus, a task becomes a project when it has the <project> element. Check if parser is incorrectly setting project field on regular tasks.

2. Stale data: The applyTransaction merge logic may not be handling updates correctly. When a task is updated, old fields should be replaced. Check:
   - mergeTask() in DatabaseLoader.kt
   - How 'delete' op is handled
   - Transaction ordering (base first, then by timestamp)

Compare carefully with Go implementation in go/pkg/ofocus/reader.go mergeTask().
close_reason: Fixed parseProjectInfo() to return null for empty <project/> elements

Issue: in-9mw
Branch: polecat/slit/in-9mw@mkk6lvch

title: Fix keystore directory error: Not a directory
description:
Error during Miden submission:
```
failed to initialize miden client: client initialization error: storage error: error creating keys directory: Os { code: 20, kind: NotADirectory, message: "Not a directory" }
```

The keystore path logic is creating a file where a directory should be, or there's a path conflict. Check src/main.rs around line 766 and the client initialization. The keystore_path is likely pointing to a file instead of a directory.

After fix: test full flow with start-all.sh --clean && test-lumia-claims.sh 1, check proxy logs for errors or success.

title: Add start-all.sh script to run everything in background
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create scripts/start-all.sh that:
1. Starts miden-node and proxy in background (docker compose up -d)
2. Waits for services to be healthy
3. Prints any errors if services fail to start
4. Returns control to user so they can run transfers in same terminal

Usage:
```
./scripts/start-all.sh           # start services in background
./scripts/start-all.sh --clean   # clean volumes first, then start
```

Script should:
- Use docker compose up -d for detached mode
- Wait and check docker compose ps for health status
- Show docker compose logs if any service fails
- Print 'Ready! Services running.' on success

title: Fix asset amount overflow - u64::MAX invalid
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Error: 'fungible asset amount 18446744073709551615 exceeds the max allowed amount'

18446744073709551615 = u64::MAX = 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

This suggests the amount is being parsed incorrectly (possibly -1 or underflow). Check:
1. Where the asset amount comes from in the claimAsset calldata
2. The decoding/parsing logic for the amount field
3. Ensure proper u64 handling without overflow/underflow
close_reason: Merged - Scale ERC20 amounts from 18 to 8 decimals for Miden

title: Fix Dockerfile: add genesis config COPY and --genesis-config-file param
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The Dockerfile.miden-node is missing:

1. COPY config/genesis.toml /app/genesis.toml
2. --genesis-config-file in the bootstrap command

Add after 'COPY --from=builder':
```
COPY config/genesis.toml /app/genesis.toml
```

Add GENESIS_FILE variable and update bootstrap:
```
'GENESIS_FILE="/app/genesis.toml"' \
...
'    miden-node bundled bootstrap \' \
'        --data-directory "$DATA_DIR" \' \
'        --accounts-directory "$ACCOUNTS_DIR" \' \
'        --genesis-config-file "$GENESIS_FILE"' \
```

The config/genesis.toml file already exists in the repo.

title: Deploy agglayer faucet before CLAIM flow
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The agglayer faucet must be deployed to the network before it can process CLAIM notes.

Flow:
1. Create bridge account
2. Create agglayer faucet
3. DEPLOY agglayer faucet (auth tx via submit_new_transaction)
4. Create ephemeral account
5. Create claim note
6. Submit tx with claim note

Reference: https://github.com/0xMiden/miden-client/blob/e235c726a6191f1577f6b98d8a8aa6c07d17a0e3/bin/miden-cli/src/commands/new_account.rs#L357

The deploy logic:
- Get auth procedure MAST root from account
- Compile auth script with dyncall
- Build TransactionRequestBuilder with script
- Submit via client.submit_new_transaction()

title: Fix miden-node RPC URL to include http:// prefix
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The --rpc.url parameter expects a full URL.

Change default from:
  0.0.0.0:57291
to:
  http://0.0.0.0:57291

One line fix in Dockerfile.miden-node entrypoint.

title: Fix empty database display - parsing not working
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

FOUND THE ISSUE: The Android OFParser.kt sets 'factory.isNamespaceAware = true' but the Go parser does NOT use namespace awareness. This causes XmlPullParser to not match element names correctly when the OmniFocus XML uses the default namespace.

FIX: In OFParser.kt line 53-54, change:
factory.isNamespaceAware = true
to:
factory.isNamespaceAware = false

Then rebuild and test. The Go implementation in go/pkg/ofocus/parser.go works without namespace awareness - the Android parser should match that behavior.

Also add logging to DatabaseLoader.kt to show how many tasks/folders/contexts were parsed so we can verify it works.
close_reason: Fixed with two commits: d2413cf (namespace fix) and 881bee5 (ViewModel scoping)

title: Hide folders with hidden=true and their contents
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

MWTT folder has <hidden>true</hidden> but still shows in Projects view.

Need to filter out:
1. Folders where hidden != null (hidden is a timestamp, non-null means hidden)
2. Projects inside hidden folders

The OFFolder.hidden field is an Instant? - if non-null, the folder is hidden.
close_reason: Replaced with rig-level beads om-ex9 and om-mbi for proper routing


Add tower-http rate limiting to prevent DoS attacks on the proxy.
